User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Open Firefox (on windows only)
Go to your intranet



Actual results:

I had to enter my windows login and password while in other navigator (IE, Chrome) I don't have to do this.

I tried playing with network.automatic-ntlm-auth.trusted-uris, network.negotiate-auth.delegation-uris and network.negotiate-auth.trusted-uris but the result wasn't excellent... some intranet sites worked, others don't...


Expected results:

It should has connect without asking me anything.

I thought this problem was because of Windows only patents or whatever, but if Chromium (which is FLOSS) can do it, I don't see why Firefox can't... I think what is missing is a way to synchronize the NTLM server names as Chromium does it.
comments.creator: romain.failliot@gmail.com
